00005 // Revision:    2012-06-13 by leoxiang
00006 
00007 #pragma once
00008 #include <poll.h>
00009 #include "lsf/asio/async/basic_event_driver.hpp"
00010 #include "lsf/util/backtrace.hpp"
00011 
00012 namespace lsf {
00013 namespace asio {
00014 namespace async {
00015 
00017 // PollEvent
00019 class PollEventDriver : public BasicEventDriver {
00020 public:
00021     static const size_t MAX_FD_NUM = 1024;
00022 
00023 public:
00024     PollEventDriver() : _fds_size(0) { memset(_fds, 0, sizeof(_fds)); }
00025 
00026     bool RegisterEvent(int fd, int flag) {
00027         if (!(flag & FLAG_READ) && !(flag & FLAG_WRITE)) return false;
00028 
00029         if (_fds_size >= MAX_FD_NUM) return false;
00030 
00031         // check existance
00032         size_t pos;
00033         for (pos = 0; pos < _fds_size; ++pos) {
00034             if (_fds[pos].fd == fd) break;
00035         }
00036 
00037         _fds[pos] = {0};
00038         _fds[pos].fd = fd;
00039         _fds[pos].events |= POLLERR | POLLHUP | POLLNVAL;
00040         // here we use EPOLLRDHUP to make epoll aware of peer close connection
00041         // or shutdown write-half of the connection, see epoll_ctl for more
00042         if (flag & FLAG_READ) _fds[pos].events |= POLLIN;
00043         if (flag & FLAG_WRITE) _fds[pos].events |= POLLOUT;
00044 
00045         if (pos == _fds_size) _fds_size++;
00046         return true;
00047     }
00048 
00049     void CancelEvent(int fd) {
00050         // find fd
00051         size_t pos;
00052         for (pos = 0; pos < _fds_size; pos++) {
00053             if (_fds[pos].fd == fd) break;
00054         }
00055         if (pos == _fds_size) return;
00056 
00057         // use memmove instead of memcpy, for overlap reason
00058         if (pos != (_fds_size - 1)) {
00059             ::memmove(_fds + pos, _fds + pos + 1, (_fds_size - 1 - pos) * sizeof(pollfd));
00060         }
00061         _fds_size--;
00062     }
00063 
00064     bool WaitEvent(int timeout) {
00065         _cur_pos = 0;
00066         if (ErrWrap(::poll(_fds, _fds_size, timeout) < 0))
00067             return false;
00068         else
00069             return true;
00070     }
00071 
00072     bool GetReadyEvent(int* pfd, int* pflag) {
00073         if (_cur_pos >= _fds_size) return false;
00074 
00075         for (; _cur_pos < _fds_size; _cur_pos++)
00076             if (_fds[_cur_pos].revents != 0) break;
00077 
00078         if (_cur_pos >= _fds_size) return false;
00079 
00080         *pflag = 0;
00081         if (_fds[_cur_pos].revents & POLLIN) *pflag |= FLAG_READ;
00082         if (_fds[_cur_pos].revents & POLLOUT) *pflag |= FLAG_WRITE;
00083         if (_fds[_cur_pos].revents & POLLERR) *pflag |= FLAG_ERR;
00084         if (_fds[_cur_pos].revents & POLLHUP) *pflag |= FLAG_ERR;
00085         if (_fds[_cur_pos].revents & POLLNVAL) *pflag |= FLAG_ERR;
00086 
00087         *pfd = _fds[_cur_pos].fd;
00088 
00089         _cur_pos++;
00090         return true;
00091     }
00092 
00093     size_t GetRegisterEventSize() const { return _fds_size; }
00094 
00095 private:
00096     pollfd _fds[MAX_FD_NUM];
00097     size_t _fds_size = 0;
00098     size_t _cur_pos = 0;
00099 };
00100 
00101 }  // end of namespace async
00102 }  // end of namespace asio
00103 }  // end of namespace lsf
00104
